para.text: What is the Cobalt presentation?

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.50; background-color:#ffffff; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: The Cobalt presentation is an HTML project, just like any other website. The only difference is that the Cobalt presentation has a file structure compatible with Cobalt builds, therefore it can be create for all the supported platforms. The Cobalt presentation is an HTML project which uses the component approach to simplify a development process. The significant advantage of using components is that you can add new functionality to the presentation by installing them. A Component is a ready-for-use unit that you can integrate into the presentation. Components are developed independently from the projects where they are used. It means that all fixes and improvements in components can only be brought to your project by updating components (normally, it's done with one console command). Since browsers don't support the component approach, initially, the presentation needs to be built.

para.text: The Development build

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.50; background-color:#ffffff; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: During the presentation development, you will use the development build. This is the fastest build, and it's used to preview the presentation in the browser. The development build is part of Cobalt CLI and is created locally on your machine. We use the
co debug --open
command to run the development build

para.text: The Production build

para.style: line-height:1.50; background-color:#ffffff; tabstops:none;
para.text: The Production build transforms the presentation for the CLM of your choice. A built presentation can be downloaded from your eWizard account (click the
details
section of your presentation and download an appropriate build). Also, you can download a build via Cobalt CLI - just run the
co export --list
command to get the list of recent builds, then find the ID of the build you want to download and run
co export --get <ID>
. A downloaded archive can be uploaded to the CLM afterwards. eWizard provides integration with some CLMs which make it possible to export the presentation to the CLM directly.

para.style: line-height:1.50; background-color:#ffffff; tabstops:none;
para.text: Read more about production build commands in section Export presentation commands.
